actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Public Works + Transportation.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Public Buildings and Grounds.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation
actions.text: Subcommittee Hearings Held.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation
actions.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee (Amended).

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation
actions.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation
actions.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation
actions.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended).
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Public Works + Transportation. H. Rept. 101-326.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 79.
Placed on the Consent Calendar, Calendar No. 2.
Called up from the Consent Calendar for consideration.
By request of Mr. Gordon the House passed over the measure without prejudice.
Mr. Anderson moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
The chair announced that a second on the motion to suspend the rules is not required.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions.committee: Committee on Environment and Public Works
actions.text: Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

actions.in_committee: Committee on Environment and Public Works
actions.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Committee on Environment and Public Works. Reported to Senate by Senator Burdick without amendment. Without written report.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 536.
Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.
Cleared for White House.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Measure Signed in Senate.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 101-297.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Public Buildings and Grounds

official_title: To redesignate the Federal buildings and court house located in East St. Louis, Illinois, as the "Melvin Price Federal Courthouse".

summary.text: Redesignates the Federal Building and the United States Courthouse in East St. Louis, Illinois, as the Melvin Price Federal Building and United States Courthouse.

titles.title: To redesignate the Federal buildings and court house located in East St. Louis, Illinois, as the "Melvin Price Federal Courthouse".
